title: Create Thunderbird email body using bash script
content:
I want to create a semi-automated email, where the body of the email is supplied from a text file. The email is created using bash script that is launched from a desktop icon. My system is Linux Mint.

This works quite well except that if the email body contains commas then everything from the comma on-wards does not appear. For example if the email body should be "Hello Fred, In response to your email of the...", what appears is "Hello Fred".

I have tried changing the HTML/Text settings in Thunderbird, but to no avail. Have also tried creating an email from the terminal, but again the result is the same.

I would very much appreciate some guidance with this.
creator: perryg

title: Number of selected feeds
content:
How do I enable the display of the number of selected feeds? I have all toolbars enabled, but as I select feeds in the navigation panel, I don't see the changing number anywhere. The context menu of selected feeds only has the following items:

  1. Options
  2. Open in New Tab
  3. Open in New Window
  4. Delete
  5. Move To >
  6. Copy To >
  7. Compact
  8. Mark Folder as Read
creator: Joseff_Key

title: How do I know which feeds were ignored during import?
content: I imported an OPML file with 1872 feeds into Thunderbird 140.0b2 (64-bit), and having no other way to tell if all the feeds were imported successfully, I exported the result to OPML. It turned out that 1871 feeds were imported. I have no idea which feed was skipped. I can figure this out after processing using a spreadsheet, but it would be much more convenient to get a list of erroneous feeds with errors right in the import window.
creator: Joseff_Key

title: How do I get (and change) feed information?
content:
When I import feeds from OPML, I can open the feed properties window ("Folder Properties"), but the only text data I can see is "Name" (taken from "text" or "title") and "Location" (assigned to the feed by the application, and looks like `mailbox://nobody@Feeds/Google Alerts. 941f2f87`). So the feed properties do not have the feed address (xmlUrl), which would allow it to be uniquely identified with feeds in the OPML file, feeds in another aggregator application, or with the Google Alerts interface. Also, when importing, the htmlUrl address, which is used to specify the address of the web interface for managing feeds (useless information for the application, but sometimes useful to the user), seems to be lost.

Also, as far as I understand, Thunderbird does not provide the user with the ability to see the date a feed was added to the application (or filter or sort feeds by this property), or an error log when updating it. Is this correct?
creator: Joseff_Key

title: Incorrect export of feeds to OPML
content:
(Unable to send a bug report via connect.mozilla.org, I have to leave feedback here.) After importing feeds from OPML into Thunderbird 140.0b2 (64-bit), I will export them.

I had to attach fragments of files as screenshots because this site does not allow formatting text as code and removes part of the text.

It seems to me that the export is broken because the generated file lacks both a link to the feed itself (xmlUrl) and to the management web page (htmlUrl). And if the latter is not critical, then without a link to the feed the generated OPML file is useless.
creator: Joseff_Key

What do I need to do to rectify this?
creator: Jamesrsamec41

title: paragraph spacing
content: I am struggling trying to get a consistent format in Thunderbird. First of all let me say that I am happy with the default use of paragraph style and if I want to have occasional single spacing I can use shift-enter instead of enter. Most queries on formatting seem to be about getting single spacing all the time. That is not my issue. That means that if I compose an email from scratch everything is just the way I want it, using the default settings. The problem arises when I reply to an email. The settings then seem to be ignored. For instance the line spacing can be fixed to single spacing whether I select paragraph or body text and no matter what I do I can't get it to follow the default behaviour. Also, I noticed that the font goes to "sans-serifArial" instead of the usual "Variable Width". In fact if I try to select "Variable Width" in the Format menu it is just ignored. How do I get the default composition settings when I reply to an incoming email?
creator: hughtmccullough

title: Doubled incoming emails AND outgoing message failure for SOME email addresses
content:
A week or two ago I started having two problems with Thunderbird, but only with some emails related to my clients. Here is a description of each problem (in case the problems are related):

Doubled incoming emails

Emails received at my address david@nsrusa.org are being received and displayed twice. I have set both my email domain servers to delete messages from the server, which is the top advice always given for this problem. The advice doesn't work for me.

Outgoing message failure

Some messages I send using Reply (perhaps the doubled messages) are getting "stuck" in my email server, which keeps sending me updates on this failure. Here is the start of a typical failure message:

This message was created automatically by mail delivery software. A message that you sent has not yet been delivered to one or more of its recipients after more than 48 hours on the queue on server.springtimesoftware.com.

The message identifier is: 1uQFjK-00GA1j-05 The date of the message is: Fri, 13 Jun 2025 21:30:45 -0400 The subject of the message is: Re: Your recent postings

The addresses to which the message has not yet been delivered are: 

 ***@bol.com.br    host mx3.bol.com.br [200.147.41.201]    Delay reason: SMTP error from remote mail server after RCPT TO:<***@bol.com.br>:    450 4.7.25 Client host rejected: cannot find your hostname, [69.48.183.241]  ***@gereconsult.com    Delay reason: H=mx-vip-01.kinghost.net [191.6.216.38]:    SMTP error from remote mail server after RCPT TO:<silviomartins@gereconsult.com>:    450 4.7.25 Client host reje

My environment: Mailservers are mail.nsrusa.org and mail.springtimesoftware.com, both at IP address 69.48.183.241, Windows 11 Home 64, Thunderbird 128.8.1esr 32 (I have just updated to 128.11.1esr), hp laptop.
creator: David536

title: Cannot conenct to SMTP server or autoconfig server without new profile.
content:
On replpacing our SMTP server, we've found a strange problem.

Connecting to the SMTP server through TLS, the connection fails, if we add another account, it can't get the configuration data from autoconfig.domain.

Using wireshark it appears that it doesn't even attampt to resolve or connect to the autoconfig server (or connect throughj a proxy).

I can change the SMTP configuration to send insecurely (server can be accessed internally).

If I use a portable copy of thunderbird or start a new User Profile, both autoconfig and connecting to the server works, but all existing users profiles are broken in exactly the same way.

Does anyone know if there's a way to fix the profiles withough removing them and starting from scratch?

TIA for any help in resolving this.
creator: zhadnost

title: Cannot read mail in my "Local Folder"
content:
Hi,

My local folder is on my Unraid sever. I have full access to the sever, In thunderbird I can see all my mails in "local Folder" I can transfer mail in the local folder and move them around, create new subfolders. But I cannot open any mail. I tried to change the directory of the local folder to a different source and back to my server. Nothing.... I can see every thing, move things around, but I just can't open any mail??? It's not a server access problem, because I wouldn't be able to move files in or out of the "local Folder" repertoire.

Any Ideas, J-P

title: email accounts expand when program opened
content:
I have 4 email accounts setup in Thunderbird. When I turn my laptop on and open the program all the email accounts automatically expand(open to show their folders). I then have scroll up thru all the accounts and folders to get back to the top account. If I don't shut down or reboot they will stay closed or go back to what state they were in when last closed. If I reboot or turn on pc again they all expand.

I shut down and boot many times a day when moving around the office or on calls. So it kinda annoys me and slows me down. I cant seem to find a setting that fixes this if it is even possible. I want them to stay closed till I open them.

title: Moving profile to another computer
content: I had a computer running Windows 10 and Thunderbird. I was able to recover the Thunderbird folder as the computer crashed. I noticed 2 folders under profiles. One is default and the other one default-release. Both of them have data. I got a new computer running latest revision of Windows 11 and after installing Thunderbird and NO setting any account I checked the Thunderbird folder and found 2 folders under Profiles One is default but has only one file and the other one is default-release having a bunch of different folders (data). Now following thunderbird help video to transfer data to a new computer I am presented with a question Do you want to merge the backup Thunderbird folder with the new one and have no other option? If I answer yes I will not have any previous data and if I answer no I am wondering I will ended up with 4 folders under Thunderbird folder and unpredictable output opening Thunderbird. Can you please help me guiding me how to get the original structure as I had in my original computer running Windows 10. Thanks
